articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: In July 2021, Hearts managed to sully Kyogo Furuhashi’s competitive debut for Celtic but this season’s top scorer is determined they will not stall the club’s title ambitions when they square up again this weekend.
articles.title: Kyogo Furuhashi reveals 'honour' of staying at Celtic as striker aims to keep up Hearts scoring record

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic’s Matt O’Riley has urged caution in seeing footballers as public property and not people.
articles.title: 'It shouldnt be overlooked that a footballer is a person' - Celtic's Matt O'Riley appeals for better understanding

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Hibs’ new director of football Brian McDermott played a role in scouting many of the current Celtic stars but now he wants to use his contacts and expertise to help the Easter Road side flourish.
articles.title: Brian McDermott says Celtic role prepped him for Hibs - 'all the players you see playing for them now, I watched'

articles.author: Graham Bean
articles.description: Sione Tuipulotu spent Saturday helping Glasgow Warriors reach their first European final and Sunday watching Celtic beat Rangers to book a place in the Scottish Cup equivalent.
articles.title: Celtic semi-final win was icing on cake for Sione Tuipulotu after Glasgow Warriors booked cup final place

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Matt O'Riley has insisted that talk of a sizeable gap between Celtic and Rangers is "harsh" on the Ibrox club.
articles.title: Celtic midfielder in surprising Rangers admission as talk of Old Firm gap branded 'harsh'

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic’s Matt O'Riley revealed he has no qualms with the later Scottish Cup final kick-off time as it means he can get a few hours extra kip before the big match.
articles.title: Celtic star reveals 'one positive' behind Scottish Cup final kick-off change as Billy Dodds slams decision

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic and Rangers are set to meet for the third time this week as the Old Firm rivals prepare to go head-to-head in a crucial Scottish Women's Premier League clash in Airdrie on Thursday.
articles.title: Celtic Women v Rangers Women TV channel: How to watch SWPL derby, kick-off time, venue

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic under-18 coach Stuart McLaren revelled in the Ange Postecoglou factor following his team’s astonishing 6-5 extra-time Youth Cup final success over rivals Rangers.
articles.title: Celtic coach reveals Ange Postecoglou factor behind Youth Cup win as Rangers seethe over red card

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: For so long there has been an inevitability to Celtic’s romp towards the Premiership title - not that anyone at the club would publicly admit it.
articles.title: Reality dawning on Celtic star as pre-match jitters admission made ahead of potential title clincher

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: As the goals mounted up at a head-spinning rate in the Youth Cup final, the excruciating defending implicated in all-too-many led one observer to bemoan that the encounter resembled a “playground game”.
articles.title: Celtic and Rangers serve up Hampden hijinx as Hoops edge 11-goal thriller Scottish Youth Cup final

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Referee Bobby Madden has revealed that he attended Rangers matches in his childhood as he addressed the rumours regarding his support of the Ibrox club.
articles.title: Are you a Rangers fan? Referee Bobby Madden breaks silence over club allegience rumours

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic and Inverness have hit out at the Scottish FA following confirmation that the Scottish Cup final has been moved from its traditional 3pm slot.
articles.title: Celtic and Inverness hit out at SFA as Scottish Cup final moved from 3pm slot

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Hearts interim manager Steven Naismith insists Celtic's potential title party is "irrelevant" and will not form part of his team talk ahead of Sunday's Premiership clash at Tynecastle.
articles.title: Celtic title party branded 'irrelevant' as Steven Naismith makes Hearts team talk vow

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Hearts interim manager Steven Naismith insists Celtic's potential title party is "irrelevant" and will not form part of his team talk ahead of Sunday's Premiership clash at Tynecastle.
articles.title: Celtic title party branded 'irrelevant' as Hearts boss Steven Naismith makes team talk vow

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Leeds United have appointed Sam Allardyce to save them from relegation with the ex-England manager set to draft in a former Celtic favourite to assist him.
articles.title: Celtic hero set for key role as Leeds United appoint Sam Allardyce to stave off relegation

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Despite their struggles against Celtic, Rangers have been tipped to reach the Champions League group stages and to be in a higher pot than their rivals.
articles.title: Rangers predicted to reach Champions League group stages and be in higher pot than Celtic, possible opponents

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Callum McGregor has revealed that the current crop of “special” Celtic players remind him of the men who proved themselves invincible throughout the 2016/17 season.
articles.title: 'Sometimes you get a feeling that you have special guys in there with you' - why this current Celtic crop are cut above

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Aberdeen desire change to Scottish football’s disciplinary system but have no intention of “burning the place down”, instead wanting to work with the SFA and other clubs to bring in change for good.
articles.title: Aberdeen 'don't want to burn place down' when it comes to disciplinary review

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Anthony Ralston has declared himself ready to step into any void left by Alistair Johnston after the Celtic full-back hobbled out of Hampden in a moon boot and on crutches on Sunday.
articles.title: Anthony Ralston ready to fill Alistair Johnston void if defender is sidelined by injury

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: John Hartson has backed Celtic to overtake Rangers' record of 55 Scottish titles after insisting that his former club are "lightyears" ahead of their Glasgow rivals.

articles.description: There was once a time when Scottish football enjoyed sufficient confidence to stand on its own two feet.

articles.description: Celtic have confirmed they will travel to Japan and South Korea for a pre-season tour ahead of the 2023/24 Scottish Premiership season.

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: If Celtic do go onto lift their fifth treble in seven years next month, as so many expect will happen, an unlikely figure can be deemed to have played a part in the process.

articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou is adamant that 25 years of hard work have taken him to the cusp of landing a domestic treble in his second season in charge of the club and that the notion of luck should not enter the conversation.

articles.description: Police Scotland will have increased powers to tackle the use of pyrotechnics come the Scottish Cup final at the start of June, the Scottish Government has confirmed.
articles.title: Scottish Government in 'further measures' promise to police for tackling pyro after Rangers v Celtic smoke

articles.description: The SPFL will not request clubs play ‘God Save the King’ ahead of this weekend’s fixtures to mark the coronation of King Charles as the Premier League have in England.

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: There was good news and bad news as Celtic edged a step closer to claiming the domestic treble. The Parkhead side saw off challengers Rangers to move into the Scottish Cup final, where they will face Championship side Inverness Caledonian Thistle, but manager Ange Postecoglou then revealed that man of the match Cameron Carter-Vickers will sit out the remainder of the season as he undergoes surgery for a knee injury.

articles.description: Mayday will have very different connotations for Michael Beale when he wakes up at the start of this week. It might equal a Spring bank holiday for most people.
